Parents... if you're operating in burnout mode, this one's for you.

You can 100% delegate more tasks on your plate than you realize.

The 4-day workweek is the future. 

@wttj has done a 4-day work week since 2019, and we couldn't imagine going back. 😊 

No more #burnout, no meetings for meetings-sake, and we don't make anyone sacrifice pay. 

This can become commonplace if we keep asking for it! 🤝

quotedTweet.rawContent:
The results of the world’s largest trial of a 4-day week (with no loss of pay) are out:

▪️ No drop in revenue

▪️ 65% fewer sick days

▪️ 71% less burnout

▪️ 92% of companies decide to keep the policy after the trial

The conclusion is clear: we need a shorter working week.

Not worth it.

Do whatever you feel relax.

Recharge well before work hard again!

Don't forget, laughter is a strong medicine, too.

Go and have some fun! 

#burnout #stress🤩

media.altText: Title Autistic Realms, 4 concentric circles with a spiral in the middle of the centre circle. Larger outer circle I has the words Environment and Connections, next circle; has the word inter-sectionality, next circle has the words communication needs, sensory needs and social needs. The Inner circle reads 'effectiveness of monotropic thought process engagement and learning outcomes. There is then an image of a spiral with an arrow pointing to a text box which reads If you have  unmet needs this could lead to anxiety monotropic split and autistic burnout cycle pic 1 of 3

Pale pink background, title reads Autistic Realms, there are 2 text boxes with the image of a spiral in the centre of the picture. The first text box reads;The environment has to meet needs. If Autistic people do not have understanding & support from others to safely be their authentic selves; then masking, external triggers & stress can lead to further anxiety. Anxiety impacts regulation and the ability to focus and use energy effectively in order  to  change attention channels. This can eventually lead to monotropic split & Autistic Burnout.  The second text box reads; Over time, without enough rest and recharge this can lead to further anxiety, sensory dysregulation & mental health issues. Some Autistic people may end up in an Autistic Burnout cycle. 
It references the golden equation by Luke Beardon Autism + Environment  = outcome. Pic 2/3

Title reads Autistic Realms, Autistic Burnout and Monotropic Spiral (Tanya Adkin and David Gray-Hammond 2022). There is an image of a spiral in the centre of the page with a cycle of arrows around it. The word 'triggers' is at the top centre with an arrow that points down to Autistic Burnout, an arrow goes left and leads to Monotropoic hyper focus, an arrow leads from this to Monotropic Spiral and an arrow leads from this up to Serious Mental Health needs and a final arrow in the cycle heading back up towards Autistic Burnout.  
The text underneath reads; Autistic people need time to recover, rest and recharge in an environment that meets needs with people they feel a positive connection with. 
his references the work of "Autistic people and the burnout-psychosis cycle" can be found :-
www.emergentdivergence.com  Pic 3/3
